definition: hammer/to hammer into shape/weight (e.g. of a steelyard or balance)/to strike with a hammer

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
a one-off, short-sighted deal/a one-shot, all-out attempt

sentences.english: A screwdriver and a hammer are the only tools you need.
sentences.chinese: 你需要用的工具只是改錐和錘子。

sentences.english: Hammer and sickle symbols of the industrial worker and the peasant are used as the emblem of the ussr .
sentences.chinese: 代表產業工人和農民的錘子鐮刀圖案用作前蘇聯國徽。

sentences.english: His symbol was fire and a blacksmith's hammer.
sentences.chinese: 他的象徵是火和鐵匠的錘子。

sentences.english: Down came the hammer and out flew the sparks.
sentences.chinese: 錘子敲下來，閃出了火花。

sentences.english: When the steel was placed in ice water and hit with a hammer, it shattered.
sentences.chinese: 當鋼鐵被安放在冰水中並用錘子敲打時，它碎掉了。

sentences.english: But now they break down the carved work thereof at once with axes and hammers.
sentences.chinese: 聖所中一切雕刻的，他們現在用斧子錘子打壞了。

sentences.english: He took a hammer from the bench and picked out a few nails from one of the disordered bins.
sentences.chinese: 他從長凳上拿起錘子，又從雜物箱裏摸出了幾個釘子。

sentences.english: Have you ever used a hammer and screwdriver to loosen a nut from a bolt?
sentences.chinese: 您是否曾經使用一個錘子和螺絲刀來卸下一個螺母？

sentences.english: Hammers are used for hitting nails into wood.
sentences.chinese: 錘子用來把釘子敲進木頭裏。

sentences.english: The hammer thumped against the wood.
'I grew up in a home where each of us had our own hammer, ' says Sully.
sentences.chinese: 薩倫伯格說，我成長在一個大家都有自己錘子的家庭。

sentences.english: We need to locate this computer and destroy it with hammers .
sentences.chinese: 我們要做的就是找到這臺計算機，並用錘子把它打爛。

sentences.english: They also make sesame candy by pounding the seeds into paste with big hammers.
sentences.chinese: 人們還用大錘子將芝麻壓進麪糊裏做芝麻糖。

sentences.english: You need a hammer to drive the nail in.
sentences.chinese: 你需要一把錘子把釘子敲進去。

sentences.english: The mark was made by a hammer.
The clerk brought him a hammer.
sentences.chinese: 這個店員給了他一個錘子。

definition: hammer/to hammer into shape/weight (e.g. of a steelyard or balance)/to strike with a hammer
easily/without trouble/while one is at it/in passing/handy
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
gun/firearm/rifle/spear/thing with shape or function similar to a gun/CL:支[zhi1],把[ba3],桿|杆[gan3],條|条[tiao2],枝[zhi1]/to substitute for another person in a test/to knock/classifier for rifle shots
